jurisdiction.title: National Consortium for Health Science Education

8417FEF7D3AA437D9B4DFAF11447A60E.description: Demonstrate appropriate usage of email and social media in a work environment (such as: work-related communications, personal texting on own time, appropriate language and content, use full language sentences).

44D07FB513AE43EC9D7FA3C7798A537D.description: Identify uses of basic word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.

BA0D981D57274CCB810B3EB1F0A4C951.description: Demonstrate use of file organization and information storage.

7930AA22F1D4441C8C69DF88A67E3435.description: Demonstrate basic computer troubleshooting procedures (such as: restart, check power supply, refresh browser, check settings).

166D26C5D06E44B588CC3E89938629C7.description: Apply basic computer concepts and terminology necessary to use computers and other mobile devices.

6E33A9F7655C407FAA79D6646F8DF902.description: Understand the principle to correct inaccurate information/errors entered into an EHR/EMR (such as: adding, clarifying, and correcting information).

71AF85604B5B4DF7AA8B1FF0ED8653E9.description: Describe consequences of inappropriate use of health data in terms of disciplinary action.

29728D084B674ED88432D6F048009547.description: Identify common policies and procedures for proper access, disclosure and protection of personal health information (such as: passwords, administrative safeguards, database security).

7F4B11DFEF764FCA9518C2D840A4EB74.description: Identify legal and regulatory requirements related to the use of personal health information (such as: Health Information Technology Act—HITECH Act, American Recovery and Reinvestment Act—ARRA).

6920E12ABD6F4319901E892F4CC9557A.description: Apply fundamentals of privacy and confidentiality policies and procedures (HIPAA).

6D452BAAA1134EC181C405748C0D135C.description: Privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information

589426333600436FBDD5AC37151BAC6D.description: Adhere to information systems policies, procedures, and regulations as required by national, state, and local entities.

E44A8D551EEE4CD695B9132B65442A21.description: Create documentation in EHR/EMRs that reflect timeliness, completeness, and accuracy.

23B457101CF04D379CD75C8E1160484A.description: Identify the types and content of an EHR/EMR (such as: pharmacy, laboratory, radiology).

AB60BB01AAA448E79F650DE4EFA16D7F.description: Explore different types of health record data collection tools (such as: patient monitoring equipment, telemedicine, phone application, and medical wearable devices).

91D688FFF27C414B82AFEEDA781D23B8.description: Identify types of data collected in Electronic Health Records/Electronic Medical Records (EHR or EMR) (such as: history and physical, medications, diagnostic tests, patient demographics).

1F34EABBEAED47388BE553628482CD65.description: Key Principles of Health Information Systems

719450EF949B4519837EB568CA7675CE.description: Information Technology Applications: Utilize and understand information technology applications common across health professions.

27591EE717CB41BFB04F2ADA26B6D0FC.description: Obtain training or certification in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), automated external defibrillator (AED), foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO) and first aid.

D0143A1F0B1341528FF105643759E639.description: Apply procedures for measuring and recording vital signs including the normal ranges (temperature, pulse, respirations, blood pressure, pain).

E0FA4E3A7F6C48F7ABE5BC9A0CECC367.description: Technical Skills: Apply technical skills required for all career specialties and demonstrate skills and knowledge as appropriate.

DBE43FFA0C134AE584A9591F95138F4F.description: Investigate complementary and alternative health practices as they relate to wellness and disease prevention (such as: Eastern medicine, holistic medicine, homeopathy, manipulative and natural therapies).

E58EBB3ED4B04E118D9ACED8EE8C7BA9.description:
Describe strategies for prevention of disease.
  1. Routine physical exams
  2. Medical, dental, and mental health screenings
  3. Community health education outreach programs
  4. Immunizations
  5. Stress management
  6. Avoid risky behaviors

1244A7266CCC4C51B8BF4EE5D02F1A73.description: Promote behaviors of health and wellness (such as: nutrition, weight control, exercise, sleep habits).

ABD4034434CF405BB8428185A83F9F93.description: Health Maintenance Practices: Differentiate between wellness and disease. Promote disease prevention and model healthy behaviors.

218B50CE0AFA46DD9EE7ADC85F5C9B7A.description: Apply effective techniques for managing team conflict (negotiation, assertive communication, gather the facts, clear expectations, mediation).

369789EA162940999D33B2C78F9F16A7.description:
Analyze attributes and attitudes of an effective leader.
  1. Characteristics (interpersonal skills, focused on results, positive)
  2. Types (autocratic, democratic, laissez faire)
  3. Roles (sets vision, leads change, manages accountability)

A4DD89808AB64EE081366B06A29A4B6C.description: Recognize methods for building positive team relationships (such as: mentorships and teambuilding).

452B5CE76E5D466EAB52F4327F6F759F.description:
Identify characteristics of effective teams.
  1. Active participation
  2. Commitment
  3. Common goals
  4. Cultural sensitivity
  5. Flexibility
  6. Open to feedback
  7. Positive attitude
  8. Reliability
  9. Trust
  10. Value individual contributions

66F0489E2CCC444B8A734B5804FE7998.description:
Evaluate roles and responsibilities of team members.
  1. Examples of healthcare teams
  2. Responsibilities of team members
  3. Benefits of teamwork

C16017463ED24B40B941FEEBE587285F.description: Teamwork: Identify roles and responsibilities of individual members as part of the healthcare team.

91A6724CC1BD4A2288F2DFCD0A7D4A81.description: Apply principles of basic emergency response in natural disasters and other emergencies (safe location, contact emergency personnel, follow facility protocols).

35D06140E78149ED94AD21D55657A251.description: Practice fire safety in a healthcare setting.

9420178496554C219795DD6F840F2EEC.description: Comply with safety signs, symbols, and labels.

B48282538DC14F15B2BF4F8401337356.description: Observe all safety standards related to the Occupational Exposure to Hazardous Chemicals Standard (Safety Data Sheets (SDSs)). (www.osha.gov)

EA8579F00296492B87BEC468520A483C.description:
Apply safety techniques in the work environment.
  1. Ergonomics
  2. Safe operation of equipment
  3. Patient/client safety measures (check area for safety)

3813336338424E11B261AAEC26357AC0.description: Apply personal safety procedures based on Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Centers for Disease Control (CDC) regulations.

E7E1124CFD604A70AD19EF1FF54AE936.description:
Differentiate methods of controlling the spread and growth of microorganisms.
  1. Aseptic control (antisepsis, disinfection, sterilization, sterile technique)
  2. Standard precautions
  3. Isolation precautions
  4. Blood borne pathogen precautions
  5. Vaccinations

7A9AE64381BD4C1F9D77B86BA5C7CD0F.description:
Explain principles of infection control.
  1. Chain of infection
  2. Mode of transmission (direct, indirect, vectors, common vehicle [air, food, water], healthcare-associated infections [nosocomial], opportunistic)
  3. Microorganisms (non-pathogenic, pathogenic, aerobic, anaerobic)
  4. Classifications (bacteria, protozoa, fungi, viruses, parasites)

98ECD0781BE5425F83B6961C68878A72.description: Safety Practices: Identify existing and potential hazards to clients, co-workers, and self. Employ safe work practices and follow health and safety policies and procedures to prevent injury and illness.

D5FAECEE604349518A6AAE71265D3FCE.description: Demonstrate respectful and empathetic treatment of ALL patients/clients (such as: customer service, patient satisfaction, civility).

1269BD704C34463AACEAB344CEFFD814.description: Discuss religious and cultural values as they impact healthcare (such as: ethnicity, race, religion, gender).

3C4B4DC76FE54843AB4265BA3576161A.description: Utilize procedures for reporting activities and behaviors that affect the health, safety, and welfare of others (such as: incident report).

CE6685D795AE4FC89D4F3560F0F3AF8F.description: Identify ethical issues and their implications related to healthcare (such as: organ donation, in vitro fertilization, euthanasia, scope of practice, ethics committee).

64F2B4BB7B47494BB6E8B12266B80069.description: Differentiate between ethical and legal issues impacting healthcare.

F8B0BCDFE3814FE9A67BD38A2BDBB8E9.description: Ethics: Understand accepted ethical practices with respect to cultural, social, and ethnic differences within the healthcare environment.

9748BC41B67D4A568C69626932DD5E20.description: Explain laws governing harassment and scope of practice.

D2341F4F6248446CA4D1246B3E752DAD.description: Summarize the essential characteristics of a patient's basic rights within a healthcare setting.

B7DD9820BA044190B00EF7E2A23B2F48.description: Apply standards for the safety, privacy and confidentiality of health information (HIPAA, privileged communication).

35A2A2C974BF4097B39658D9C6E163F4.description:
Analyze legal responsibilities and implications of criminal and civil law.
  1. Malpractice
  2. Negligence
  3. Assault
  4. Battery
  5. Invasion of privacy
  6. Abuse
  7. Lible
  8. Slander

64893B3AEC6845828A91CA7C377F8F90.description: Legal Responsibilities: Describe legal responsibilities, limitations, and implications on healthcare worker actions.

18F919543A564B0AA92FB11D98AEFA9C.description: Identify strategies for pursuing employment (social media, personal networking, job sites, internships).

945604C05C894C0E8A52DC0AC2FCA2FB.description:
Develop components of a personal portfolio.
  1. Letter of introduction
  2. Resume
  3. Sample Projects
  4. Writing Sample
  5. Work-based Learning Documentation
  6. Oral Report
  7. Service Learning/Community Service
  8. Credentials
  9. Technology Skills
  10. Leadership Examples

2AEF5D935CA048478F409D2F80F7F9A9.description: Distinguish differences among careers within health science pathways (diagnostic services, therapeutic services, health informatics, support services, or biotechnology research and development).

A6AAB9AB277D4D0AAFBAD5ABB67D6B63.description: Research levels of education, credentialing requirements, and employment trends in health professions.

371ED9B177C54781BBAF7B51E9F40F2B.description:
Apply employability skills in healthcare.
  1. Chain of command
  2. Correct grammar
  3. Decision making
  4. Flexible
  5. Initiative
  6. Integrity
  7. Loyalty
  8. Positive attitude
  9. Professional characteristics
  10. Prompt and prepared
  11. Responsibility
  12. Scope of practice
  13. Teamwork
  14. Willing to learn

1FEACAC7649A4D71A643D0D9ED1D8A4E.description: Summarize professional standards as they apply to hygiene, dress, language, confidentiality and behavior.

DB1659A815424D4DAB2C3C0E34456067.description:
Identify personal traits and attitudes desirable in a member of the career ready healthcare team.
  1. Acceptance of criticism
  2. Competence
  3. Dependability
  4. Discretion
  5. Empathy
  6. Enthusiasm
  7. Honesty
  8. Initiative
  9. Patience
  10. Responsibility
  11. Self-motivation
  12. Tact
  13. Team player
  14. Willingness to learn

FC6D7C1A587A4E8C92C60949C59B6FF9.description: Personal Traits of the Health Professional

D70BDBF6408149C2B047D71B57797213.description: Employability Skills: Utilize employability skills to enhance employment opportunities and job satisfaction.

AA4A1906E8724594980BF45802480E32.description:
Discuss healthcare economics and common methods of payment for healthcare.
  1. Private health insurance (such as: Blue Cross, Affordable Care Act - ACA)
  2. Managed care (such as: HMOs, PPOs, medical home)
  3. Government programs (Medicare, Medicaid, Tricare, and Workers' Compensation)

4E97CA80983143FFBA7867525016ABA5.description: Assess the impact of emerging issues on healthcare delivery systems (such as: technology, epidemiology, bioethics, socioeconomics).

5FEDE43E2F144CBEA24B09FA7271A5C8.description: Describe the responsibilities of consumers within the healthcare system (such as: self-advocacy, patient compliance, provider and consumer obligations).

8C0D4BF10B8C4C098232278C93BC2BA1.description:
Compare healthcare delivery systems.
  1. Non-profit and for profit (such as: hospitals, ambulatory facilities, long-term care facilities, home health, medical and dental offices, mental health services)
  2. Government (such as: CDC, FDA, WHO, OSHA, Public Health systems/Health Departments, Veteran's Administration)
  3. Non-profit (such as: March of Dimes, American Heart Association)

96D2ECBE098146A49EC24954B9C9348B.description: Systems: Identify how key systems affect services performed and quality of care.

947C8284B27243AB9D57375EB16C30F9.description: Prepare examples of technical, informative, and creative writing.

CD3655C4865A4A5FB73DB156E0F94D44.description: Utilize proper elements of written and electronic communication (spelling, grammar, and formatting).

AD823C4AE5074BD69D0971A8AE0D47BB.description:
Interpret medical abbreviations to communicate information.
  1. Common abbreviations
  2. Joint Commission official "Do Not Use List"

43A5B4529FA6402E8866483B14C68341.description: Use common roots, prefixes, and suffixes to communicate information.

809396A5BDD34C53822BA7D208E2BDA0.description: Modify communication to meet the needs of the patient/client and be appropriate to the situation.

BC4286B0B03343F6B7B447771C7C6248.description: Practice speaking and active listening skills.

64969EEB0BF54DF2BBD89B4A7D3A2852.description: Interpret elements of communication using basic sender-receiver-message-feedback model.

9783FF6437084F5386952A4A3B31816A.description: Identify the differences between subjective and objective information.

962412BAE4564D8198451FDED762CE09.description:
Identify common barriers to communication.
  1. Physical disabilities (aphasia, hearing loss, impaired vision)
  2. Psychological barriers (attitudes, bias, prejudice, stereotyping)

6E614931F2B947A8A4C23FBD5C1C5251.description: Communications: Demonstrate methods of delivering and obtaining information, while communicating effectively.

FAA98488695A495FA8C018CC99A98307.description: Demonstrate use of the 24-hour clock/military time.

A6FCB110270247DBA88FC4DA611824AF.description: Demonstrate the ability to analyze diagrams, charts, graphs, and tables to interpret healthcare results.

7DF0F7FD6EA447A199F50A87AC1BBCB5.description:
Demonstrate competency in basic math skills and mathematical conversions as they relate to healthcare.
  1. Metric system (such as: centi, milli, kilo)
  2. Mathematical (average, ratios, fractions, percentages, addition, subtraction, multiplication, division)
  3. Conversions (height, weight/mass, length, volume, temperature, household measurements)

7DE47A3551994EABA55DCBD407EE61FA.description:
Describe biomedical therapies as they relate to the prevention, pathology, and treatment of disease.
  1. Gene testing
  2. Gene therapy
  3. Human proteomics
  4. Cloning
  5. Stem cell research

E5279EA43AC34054B2F5081838CC3AF9.description: Discuss research related to emerging diseases and disorders (such as: autism, VRSA, PTSD, Listeria, seasonal flu).

98CBA9483B1D4F17ADDD20A5AB5D4855.description:
Describe common diseases and disorders of each body system (such as: cancer, diabetes, dementia, stroke, heart disease, tuberculosis, hepatitis, COPD, kidney disease, arthritis, ulcers).
  1. Etiology
  2. Pathology
  3. Diagnosis
  4. Treatment
  5. Prevention

E9349B4B953D42C390B58AE22E2FB8C8.description:
Analyze basic structures and functions of human body systems (skeletal, muscular, integumentary, cardiovascular, lymphatic, respiratory, nervous, special senses, endocrine, digestive, urinary, and reproductive).
  1. Skeletal (bone anatomy, axial and appendicular skeletal bones, functions of bones, ligaments, types of joints)
  2. Muscular (microscopic anatomy of muscle tissue, types of muscle, locations of skeletal muscles, functions of muscles, tendons, directional movements)
  3. Integumentary (layers, structures and functions of skin)
  4. Cardiovascular (components of blood, structures and functions of blood components, structures and functions of the cardiovascular system, conduction system of the heart, cardiac cycle)
  5. Lymphatic (structures and functions of lymphatic system, movement of lymph fluid)
  6. Respiratory (structures and functions of respiratory system, physiology of respiration)
  7. Nervous (structures and functions of nervous tissue and system, organization of nervous system)
  8. Special senses (structures and functions of eye, ear, nose and tongue; identify senses for sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch)
  9. Endocrine (endocrine versus exocrine, structures and functions of endocrine system, hormones, regulation of hormones)
  10. Digestive (structures and functions of gastrointestinal tract, chemical and mechanical digestion, structures and functions of accessory organs)
  11. Urinary (structures and functions of urinary system, gross and microscopic anatomy, process of urine formation, urine composition, homeostatic balance)
  12. Reproductive (structures and functions of male and female reproductive systems, formation of gametes, hormone production and effects, menstrual cycle, and conception)

D9663DE1A37D48A294D4503BD95E29C7.description:
Identify body planes, directional terms, cavities, and quadrants.
  1. Body planes (sagittal, mid-sagittal, coronal/frontal, transverse/horizontal)
  2. Directional terms (superior, inferior, anterior/ventral, posterior/dorsal, medial, lateral, proximal, distal, superficial, and deep)
  3. Cavities (dorsal, cranial, spinal, thoracic, abdominal, and pelvic)
  4. Quadrants (upper right, lower right, upper left, and lower left)

82D42D45C63E4DFE852F4B28BF2FCD36.description:
Identify basic levels of organization of the human body.
  1. Chemical
  2. Cellular
  3. Tissue
  4. Organs
  5. Systems
  6. Organism

B083862A91FA4BC39225C70F243AE317.description: Academic Foundation: Understand human anatomy, physiology, common diseases and disorders, and medical math principles.
